course.title: Learn and Understand NodeJS
course.subtitle: Dive deep under the hood of NodeJS. Learn V8, Express, the MEAN stack, core Javascript concepts, and more.

reviews.body: Anthony is amazing is the second course I am taking with him and I hope he will offer more
Very good explanation with examples on Node. I liked the focus on concepts and explanations of what is happening behind the scenes.

I enjoyed the course, as someone who is a beginner like me when it comes to NodeJS this course was a great starter for me. I like how the course didn't just tackle through coding NodeJS, but establishing some basic/fundamentals of JavaScript like the 'inheritance'.

That kind of approach made me appreciate and understood well how NodeJS works under the hood. Honestly, I bought also a different course but with an advance approach and see if I could follow it, but some of it was a bit confusing to me. But know after taking this course I am now have a pretty good understanding and I am ready to take more advance course because of this. Thank you for making such a great course with good content.

Course ends abruptly: where is "Adding a front-end in Angular (Part 2)"? And despite the fact that this is an extremely outdated course, that was a good experience for me and I learned a lot of new things anyway.

Course was very well structured and instructor has focused on core concepts in a very good way. Only reason I have not made it a 5 star is that I was expecting Streams and Custom Middleware implementation to be incorporated into the final project. But very well done overall !!

O curso se aprofunda bastante em como a tecnologia funciona e explica bem claramente a maioria dos conceitos. Porém infelizmente o curso parece que não foi finalizado, faltaram vários itens para finalizar o projeto final.

This is fantastic course. It offers incredibly clear explanations of underlying concepts that get glossed over in more "advanced" courses. Importantly, Anthony builds for you a mental map that maps closely to Node itself, helping you remember, via understanding, the derivative concepts and techniques that you ultimately implement in real-world applications. The explanation of Node's event emitter alone is already worth ten times the price of the course. I wish Anthony would produce other, similar courses on full-stack development. such as in Vue.

The course was really good as it has really built up a nice foundation for me regarding backend development in Node.js the only downpoint for the course was that it isn't updated to the latest version and/or methodologies that Node has added to itself. Regardless of that this course is really good to have a concrete and basic understanding how Node.js works under the hood.

This guys is properly one of the best instructors out there.

I hate when instructors don't go into depth on a topic....it infuriates me; as I have to go and dig in deeper on a topic, basically paying money to go do extra research...

This guys really hones in an every topic, leaving no holes in his lecture. well- done.
Explained All the Concepts Very Well. This is a very good course. Tony is a great instructor. Thank you Tony for helping the Students, IT Professionals. Stay Blessed.
it was a nice course, covered many areas I needed and the teaching methods were topnotch.

instructor.name: Anthony Alicea
instructor.briefIntroduction:
Newly married in Cleveland Ohio, Tony is primarily focused these days on trying to be a good husband. While inexperienced at that, he's quite experienced in all things web.

Tony has been programming since he was 12 years old, and got into web sites and web application development at 16. After graduating with a Computer Science degree from Case Western Reserve University, Tony continued with that interest as a Microsoft certified software application developer and architect, database designer, and user interface designer.

His experience has ranged across technologies such as HTML5, CSS3, ASP .NET MVC, JavaScript, jQuery, KnockoutJS, AngularJS, NodeJS, LESS, Bootstrap, SQL, Entity Framework and more.

He believes strongly that deeply understanding any topic allows you to properly learn it and, even more importantly in a real-world environment, quickly overcome problems.

He also has a deep interest in human nature and behavior, and how that impacts human-computer interaction. This interest translated into extending his career into user experience design and usability research.

Another link in the chain is his 25 years of experience in public speaking and teaching, both in front of large groups and as a one-on-one private instructor.

Putting all these pieces together, he has spent his career listening to a client need, designing a database and software to meet that need, building it, testing it, teaching others how to use it, then improving user experience by watching people actually use it and adjusting accordingly.

Tony loves teaching every aspect of what he does, and even more loves teaching in a way that imparts understanding, as opposed to just examples intended to be parroted. He loves that moment when a student 'gets it', and that's what he wants for you when you take one of his courses.

He has found that those that learn purely by example, and not by understanding, end up much more limited than they need to be.

"Examples need to be built on top of context, and once you have context, you can not only copy the examples you find, but adjust and improve upon them."

He firmly believes that everyone has the ability to develop software, if they are just taught properly. Including you.

"It is my pleasure and privilege to teach you. I hope you'll come away knowing something you didn't before, understanding at a level deeper than before, and feeling positive that you can accomplish what you've set out to accomplish. Thank you!" - Tony Alicea

Ask Tony a question, read a post, or follow him around internet.
